intro: Knautia carinthiaca, commonly known as Carpathian knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy underneath. Its flowers are composed of five petals and are arranged in cymes, making it a striking addition to gardens. Knautia carinthiaca prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
